property.name: spark.yarn.queue
property.description: The name of the YARN queue to which the application is submitted.

property.name: spark.driver.extraLibraryPath
property.description: Set a special library path to use when launching the driver JVM.

property.name: spark.executor.extraLibraryPath
property.description: Set a special library path to use when launching the executor JVM.

property.name: spark.history.ui.port
property.description: The port to which the web interface of the History Server binds.

property.name: spark.history.fs.logDirectory
property.description: Base directory for history spark application log.

property.name: spark.history.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal name for the Spark History Server.

property.name: spark.history.kerberos.keytab
property.description: Location of the kerberos keytab file for the Spark History Server.

property.name: spark.eventLog.enabled
property.description: Whether to log Spark events, useful for reconstructing the Web UI after the application has finished.

property.name: spark.eventLog.dir
property.description: Base directory in which Spark events are logged, if spark.eventLog.enabled is true.

property.name: spark.yarn.historyServer.address
property.description: The address of the Spark history server (i.e. host.com:18081). The address should not contain a scheme (http://). Defaults to not being set since the history server is an optional service. This address is given to the YARN ResourceManager when the Spark application finishes to link the application from the ResourceManager UI to the Spark history server UI.
